page.title: 14RADIO & T.V. CENTRE, HARROW.
page.content:
The{National Catholic Radio and {Television Centre}is situated in{Hatch {End}and was founded in{1955}by Bishop Agnalis Andrew and is now run by Canon Peter Bourne. It is not a television studio but a training centre teaching people how to broadcast and use equipment. The centre houses colour television, mono and stereo sound studios, editing suites, a technical workshop, library, chapel and residential facilities.
It can take up to 18 students for courses which vary from 1 day to 10 weeks and costs Â£33 per student per night. The running costs can be up to Â£1,000 per day. Students come from all over the world and can be of any religion. The centre employs under 20 people but tutors can be invited from organisations such as the BBC.
